questions.question: What is the purpose of calibrating a pressure gauge using a Dead Weight Gauge Calibrator?

answers.a: To measure the temperature of the fluid or gas
answers.b: To determine the size of the pressure gauge
answers.c: To ensure accurate measurements of pressure
answers.d: To calculate the viscosity of the fluid

questions.question: What is a Dead Weight Gauge Calibrator?

answers.a: A device used to measure temperature
answers.b: A tool for measuring the weight of objects
answers.c: A primary standard device to generate known pressures
answers.d: A device used to calibrate flow meters

questions.question: How does a Dead Weight Gauge Calibrator generate known pressures?

answers.b: By applying weights to a piston in a fluid-filled cylinder
answers.c: By adjusting the size of the pressure chamber
answers.d: By measuring the electrical resistance of the fluid

questions.question: What should be checked before performing the calibration?

answers.a: The color of the pressure gauge
answers.b: The weight of the Dead Weight Gauge Calibrator
answers.c: The calibration certificate of the Dead Weight Gauge Calibrator (if available)
answers.d: The length of the tubing used for connection

questions.question: What is the purpose of plotting a calibration curve?

answers.a: To calculate the weight applied to the Dead Weight Gauge Calibrator
answers.b: To determine the temperature of the fluid or gas
answers.c: To assess the accuracy and linearity of the pressure gauge
answers.d: To measure the flow rate of the fluid or gas
